name: Docker Registry Opensource
description:
Registry is a stateless, highly scalable server side application that stores and lets you distribute Docker images. The Registry is open-source, under the permissive Apache license.
You should use the Registry if you want to:
* tightly control where your images are being stored
* fully own your images distribution pipeline
* integrate image storage and distribution tightly into your in-house development workflow
#### License:
* Apache License 2.0
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default, one VM with 4vCPU and 8GB RAM
#### Resources Installed:
* Docker Registry 
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708
* Select the [AWS AMI](https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/fulfillment?productId=b7ee8a69-ee97-4a49-9e68-afaee216db2e&ref_=dtl_psb_continue) according to the region.
#### Platform:
* AHV
* AWS
#### Lifecycle:
* NA
#### Limitations:
* For evaluation purpose only. Not recommended for production use.
* Single VM without redundancy and HA.
#### Other Instructions:
* Make sure port `5000` is open on AWS Security Group and Firewall. 
#### Accessibility:
* https://[IP_ADDRESS]:5000
author: Nutanix
